comments.html:
> I am to blame for trying to juggle a bunch of square pegs when the tool supports a single round hole.

It isn't your fault, NCLU really should handle that case, but sometimes it is better to ship something that is useful but not 100% right.

> you’re forced to use the NVIDIA User Experience

oh no

> The Mellanox/NVIDIA acquisition transformed a promising Linux-based operating system running on a dozen brands of whitebox and britebox into yet another NOS running on niche hardware.

I am still optimistic about the kernel's switchdev driver that Cumulus was partially responsible for. The Mellanox Spectrum switchdev driver is fantastic, and the Sparx-5 driver is extremely promising.

Sadly the Marvell Prestera driver doesn't actually drive their ASIC, but instead is an RPC proxy to an extra CPU that doesn't exist on 99% of Prestera switches. Oh well.

If I still had my youthful energy, I would write a SwitchDevInUserSpace driver (SDUSE?) and wire it up to the Open Source* Broadcom SDK: https://github.com/Broadcom-Network-Switching-Software/OpenBCM

  • I have not had a proper IP lawyer review their license, but it looks pretty MIT/BSDesque to me.
